SENT.plain: Patients with miliary tuberculosis accompanied by a pancytopenia rarely survive their disease
If the peripheral blood picture does recover it has been taken as an indication that there is no underlying haematological disease, and so re-examination of the bone marrow is not performed
A case is described where resolution of the pancytopenia occurred but a persisting haematological disease remained
Aspects of haematological disease associated with tuberculosis are discussed
